nodes.bodyText: This threadpool is never shutdown so I expect if this class is removed it will still keep the threadpool maybe either simple start the thread itself or make sure the threadpool is shutdown when this class is removed. Probably on stop it can be this class is reused and then the executor can't be shutdown there.

Are you sure this is the correct fix? If a user changes configuration dispose will be called an then the stop method here. But this class is still be used. So when start is called again in initialize it will fail as the executor is shutdown. So I think it needs a bit more thought on what is the best approach here. Also there is a newSingleThreadPool you can use instead of the fixed with 1.
